description: This course invites students to examine the figure of the Zen Buddhist master as a literary and performative figure. In addition to a broad overview of the historical development of Zen Buddhism, students use case studies of Zen masters to explore questions of power, authority, and gender. Offered occasionally during Interim. Counts toward Asian studies and religion majors and Asian studies concentration. Prerequisite: BTS-B.
name: Zen Masters and Criticism
